metadata.title: CVE-2024-8386 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
If a site had been granted the permission to open popup windows, it couldcause Select elements to appear on top of another site to perform aspoofing attack. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 130, Firefox ESR <128.2, and Thunderbird < 128.2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-8386` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 130.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 130.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 130.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '130.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
